subject: RE: [junit] name of the test
msgSnippet: In JUnit 3 finding the test name was easy, just look at fName. In JUnit 4 there is not standard way to find out. The listener does know which test is running,

In JUnit 3 finding the test name was easy, just look at fName. In JUnit 4
there is not standard way to find out. The listener does know which test is
running, via the Description.
 
The listener is not notified when calling @Before and @After methods, but
this may change because I've been wishing to be notified as part of my data
gathering efforts.
 
I'm curious what problem you are solving.
 
Regards,
 
Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
idan72
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2008 7:29 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] name of the test




Hi,

1. How can I know in the before/after test method what is the test being
running ?
2. How Can I know using listener that before/after class method is being
called?

Thanks
